instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in order to improve tissue discrimination and classification during surgery?

instruction: What metric was chosen to quantify the contributions of individual spectral channels to tissue classification in the MSI system?
Output: The metric chosen to quantify the contributions of individual spectral channels to tissue classification in the MSI system is the signal to noise ratio (SNR) of the spectral channels.

instruction: How were the convolutional neural network (CNN) models trained in the multispectral imaging (MSI) system developed in the related study?
Output: The convolutional neural network (CNN) models in the multispectral imaging (MSI) system were trained using two types of images: white light (RGB) images and MSI images. The MSI system integrated three sensors and seven illuminants. The CNN models were trained to classify 11 different types of head and neck tissues. The training process involved comparing the signal to noise ratio (SNR) of spectral channels and evaluating the impact of these channels on tissue classification performance using CNN visualization methods.

instruction: Can the metric developed in the related study to quantify the contributions of individual spectral channels be applied to other multispectral imaging (MSI) systems for improved tissue discrimination and classification during surgery?
Output: Yes.
